snippet: With a deadline looming, the mayor called on lawmakers to approve two of his housing initiatives: strengthening rent regulations and revising a program that gives tax breaks for creating affordable units.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio tells Harlem church congregation that if New York State lawmakers do not approve his proposals to amend laws in effort to build more affordable housing, he will end all tax breaks now enjoyed by developers; de Blasio wants to strengthen city's rent regulations and overhaul tax-break program known as 421-a.
lead_paragraph: With a deadline looming, the mayor called on lawmakers to approve two of his housing initiatives: strengthening rent regulations and revising a program that gives tax breaks for creating affordable units.

headline.main: De Blasio Prods New York State on Housing Laws
headline.print_headline: Mayor Prods State on Housing Laws
